message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
public static void writeResultsToFile(double g) throws IOException{
    FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter(new File("planetaryData.txt"), true);
    PrintWriter outFile = new PrintWriter(fileWriter);
    outFile.printf("%.2f%n", g);
    outFile.close();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are creating a new PrintWriter each time you call the method writeResultsToFile. This will overwrite the existing file. To append to the file instead of overwriting it, you should create a FileWriter with the append flag set to true, and then wrap this in your PrintWriter. This will ensure that each time you call the method, the new data is appended to the end of the file instead of overwriting the existing data.
